trans-unit.source: Customize HDInsight Clusters using script actions | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Customize HDInsight Clusters using script actions | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action.

trans-unit.source: Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action
trans-unit.target: Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action

trans-unit.source: Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action
trans-unit.target: Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action

trans-unit.source: HDInsight provides a configuration option called **Script Action** that invokes custom scripts, which define the customization to be performed on the cluster during the provision process.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight provides a configuration option called **Script Action** that invokes custom scripts, which define the customization to be performed on the cluster during the provision process.

trans-unit.source: These scripts can be used to install additional software on a cluster, or to change the configuration of applications on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: These scripts can be used to install additional software on a cluster, or to change the configuration of applications on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Script Action is only supported on HDInsight cluster version 3.1 or higher with the Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Script Action is only supported on HDInsight cluster version 3.1 or higher with the Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: For more information on HDInsight cluster versions, see [HDInsight cluster versions](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on HDInsight cluster versions, see [HDInsight cluster versions](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).

trans-unit.source: Script Action is available as part of the standard Azure HDInsight subscriptions at no extra charge.
trans-unit.target: Script Action is available as part of the standard Azure HDInsight subscriptions at no extra charge.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters can be customized in a variety of other ways as well, such as including additional Azure Storage accounts, changing the Hadoop configuration files (core-site.xml, hive-site.xml, etc.), or adding shared libraries (e.g., Hive, Oozie) into common locations in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters can be customized in a variety of other ways as well, such as including additional Azure Storage accounts, changing the Hadoop configuration files (core-site.xml, hive-site.xml, etc.), or adding shared libraries (e.g., Hive, Oozie) into common locations in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: These customizations can be done through Azure PowerShell, the Azure HDInsight .NET SDK, or the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: These customizations can be done through Azure PowerShell, the Azure HDInsight .NET SDK, or the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using custom options][hdinsight-provision-cluster].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using custom options][hdinsight-provision-cluster].

trans-unit.source: Script Action in the cluster provision process
trans-unit.target: Script Action in the cluster provision process

trans-unit.source: Script Action is only used while a clusters is in the process of being created.
trans-unit.target: Script Action is only used while a clusters is in the process of being created.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram illustrates when Script Action is executed during the provision process:
trans-unit.target: The following diagram illustrates when Script Action is executed during the provision process:

trans-unit.source: HDInsight cluster customization and stages during cluster provisioning
trans-unit.target: HDInsight cluster customization and stages during cluster provisioning

trans-unit.source: When the script is running, the cluster enters the **ClusterCustomization** stage.
trans-unit.target: When the script is running, the cluster enters the **ClusterCustomization** stage.

trans-unit.source: At this stage, the script is run under the system admin account, in parallel on all the specified nodes in the cluster, and provides full admin privileges on the nodes.
trans-unit.target: At this stage, the script is run under the system admin account, in parallel on all the specified nodes in the cluster, and provides full admin privileges on the nodes.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Because you have admin privileges on the cluster nodes during the **ClusterCustomization** stage, you can use the script to perform operations like stopping and starting services, including Hadoop-related services.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Because you have admin privileges on the cluster nodes during the **ClusterCustomization** stage, you can use the script to perform operations like stopping and starting services, including Hadoop-related services.

trans-unit.source: So, as part of the script, you must ensure that the Ambari services and other Hadoop-related services are up and running before the script finishes running.
trans-unit.target: So, as part of the script, you must ensure that the Ambari services and other Hadoop-related services are up and running before the script finishes running.

trans-unit.source: These services are required to successfully ascertain the health and state of the cluster while it is being created.
trans-unit.target: These services are required to successfully ascertain the health and state of the cluster while it is being created.

trans-unit.source: If you change any configuration on the cluster that affects these services, you must use the helper functions that are provided.
trans-unit.target: If you change any configuration on the cluster that affects these services, you must use the helper functions that are provided.

trans-unit.source: For more information about helper functions, see [Develop Script Action scripts for HDInsight][hdinsight-write-script].
trans-unit.target: For more information about helper functions, see [Develop Script Action scripts for HDInsight][hdinsight-write-script].

trans-unit.source: The output and the error logs for the script are stored in the default Storage account you specified for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The output and the error logs for the script are stored in the default Storage account you specified for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The logs are stored in a table with the name **u<\cluster-name-fragment><\time-stamp>setuplog**.
trans-unit.target: The logs are stored in a table with the name **u<\cluster-name-fragment><\time-stamp>setuplog**.

trans-unit.source: These are aggregate logs from the script run on all the nodes (head node and worker nodes) in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: These are aggregate logs from the script run on all the nodes (head node and worker nodes) in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Each cluster can accept multiple script actions that are invoked in the order in which they are specified.
trans-unit.target: Each cluster can accept multiple script actions that are invoked in the order in which they are specified.

trans-unit.source: A script can be ran on the head node, the worker nodes, or both.
trans-unit.target: A script can be ran on the head node, the worker nodes, or both.

trans-unit.source: Call Script Action scripts
trans-unit.target: Call Script Action scripts

trans-unit.source: Script Action scripts can be used from the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Script Action scripts can be used from the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight provides several scripts to install the following components on HDInsight clusters:
trans-unit.target: HDInsight provides several scripts to install the following components on HDInsight clusters:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Script
trans-unit.target: Script

trans-unit.source: Install Spark
trans-unit.target: Install Spark

trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/sparkconfigactionv03/spark-installer-v03.ps1.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-install-spark].
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-install-spark].

trans-unit.target: Install R

trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/rconfigactionv02/r-installer-v02.ps1.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use R on HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-install-r].
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use R on HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-install-r].

trans-unit.target: Install Solr

trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/solrconfigactionv01/solr-installer-v01.ps1.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Solr on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-solr-install.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Solr on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-solr-install.md).

trans-unit.source: - **Install Giraph**
trans-unit.target: - **Install Giraph**

trans-unit.source: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/giraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.ps1.
trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/giraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.ps1.

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Start provisioning a cluster by using the **CUSTOM CREATE** option, as described at [Provisioning a cluster using custom options](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md#portal).
trans-unit.target: Start provisioning a cluster by using the **CUSTOM CREATE** option, as described at [Provisioning a cluster using custom options](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md#portal).

trans-unit.source: On the **Script Actions** page of the wizard, click **add script action** to provide details about the script action, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: On the **Script Actions** page of the wizard, click **add script action** to provide details about the script action, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Use Script Action to customize a cluster
trans-unit.target: Use Script Action to customize a cluster

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the script action.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the script action.

trans-unit.source: Script URI
trans-unit.target: Script URI

trans-unit.source: Specify the URI to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Specify the URI to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster.

trans-unit.source: s
trans-unit.target: s

trans-unit.source: Node Type
trans-unit.target: Node Type

trans-unit.source: Specify the nodes on which the customization script is run.
trans-unit.target: Specify the nodes on which the customization script is run.

trans-unit.source: You can choose All Nodes, Head nodes only, or Worker nodes only.
trans-unit.target: You can choose All Nodes, Head nodes only, or Worker nodes only.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Specify the parameters, if required by the script.
trans-unit.target: Specify the parameters, if required by the script.

trans-unit.source: You can add more than one script action to install multiple components on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can add more than one script action to install multiple components on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark to start provisioning the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark to start provisioning the cluster.

trans-unit.source: From Azure PowerShell cmdlets
trans-unit.target: From Azure PowerShell cmdlets

trans-unit.source: Use Azure PowerShell commands for HDInsight to run a single script action or multiple script actions.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure PowerShell commands for HDInsight to run a single script action or multiple script actions.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction** cmdlet to invoke custom scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction** cmdlet to invoke custom scripts.

trans-unit.source: To use these cmdlets, you must have Azure PowerShell installed and configured.
trans-unit.target: To use these cmdlets, you must have Azure PowerShell installed and configured.

trans-unit.source: For information on configuring a workstation to run Azure PowerShell cmdlets for HDInsight, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].
trans-unit.target: For information on configuring a workstation to run Azure PowerShell cmdlets for HDInsight, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].

trans-unit.source: Use the following Azure PowerShell commands to run a single script action when deploying an HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following Azure PowerShell commands to run a single script action when deploying an HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: Use the following Azure PowerShell commands to run multiple script actions when deploying an HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following Azure PowerShell commands to run multiple script actions when deploying an HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: From the HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: From the HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides a ScriptAction class to invoke custom scripts.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides a ScriptAction class to invoke custom scripts.

trans-unit.source: To use the HDInsight .NET SDK:
trans-unit.target: To use the HDInsight .NET SDK:

trans-unit.source: Create a Visual Studio application, and then install the SDK from NuGet.
trans-unit.target: Create a Visual Studio application, and then install the SDK from NuGet.

trans-unit.source: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command in the console to install the package:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command in the console to install the package:

trans-unit.source: Create a cluster by using the SDK.
trans-unit.target: Create a cluster by using the SDK.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Provision HDInsight cluster using .NET SDK](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md#sdk).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Provision HDInsight cluster using .NET SDK](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md#sdk).

trans-unit.source: Use the **ScriptAction** class to invoke a custom script as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Use the **ScriptAction** class to invoke a custom script as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Support for open-source software used on HDInsight clusters
trans-unit.target: Support for open-source software used on HDInsight clusters

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure HDInsight service is a flexible platform that enables you to build big-data applications in the cloud by using an ecosystem of open-source technologies formed around Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure HDInsight service is a flexible platform that enables you to build big-data applications in the cloud by using an ecosystem of open-source technologies formed around Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure provides a general level of support for open-source technologies, as discussed in the **Support Scope** section of the Azure Support FAQ website.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure provides a general level of support for open-source technologies, as discussed in the **Support Scope** section of the Azure Support FAQ website.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight service provides an additional level of support for some of the components, as described below.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight service provides an additional level of support for some of the components, as described below.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of open-source components that are available in the HDInsight service:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of open-source components that are available in the HDInsight service:

trans-unit.source: **Built-in components** - These components are pre-installed on HDInsight clusters and provide core functionality of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Built-in components** - These components are pre-installed on HDInsight clusters and provide core functionality of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, YARN ResourceManager, the Hive query language (HiveQL), and the Mahout library belong to this category.
trans-unit.target: For example, YARN ResourceManager, the Hive query language (HiveQL), and the Mahout library belong to this category.

trans-unit.source: A full list of cluster components is available in What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?.
trans-unit.target: A full list of cluster components is available in What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?.

trans-unit.source: **Custom components** - You, as a user of the cluster, can install or use in your workload any component available in the community or created by you.
trans-unit.target: **Custom components** - You, as a user of the cluster, can install or use in your workload any component available in the community or created by you.

trans-unit.source: Built-in components are fully supported, and Microsoft Support will help to isolate and resolve issues related to these components.
trans-unit.target: Built-in components are fully supported, and Microsoft Support will help to isolate and resolve issues related to these components.

trans-unit.source: Custom components receive commercially reasonable support to help you to further troubleshoot the issue.
trans-unit.target: Custom components receive commercially reasonable support to help you to further troubleshoot the issue.

trans-unit.source: This might result in resolving the issue or asking you to engage available channels for the open-source technologies where deep expertise for that technology is found.
trans-unit.target: This might result in resolving the issue or asking you to engage available channels for the open-source technologies where deep expertise for that technology is found.

trans-unit.source: For example, there are many community sites that can be used, like: MSDN forum for HDInsight and Stack Overflow.
trans-unit.target: For example, there are many community sites that can be used, like: MSDN forum for HDInsight and Stack Overflow.

trans-unit.source: Also, Apache projects have project sites on Apache.org; for example, Hadoop and Spark.
trans-unit.target: Also, Apache projects have project sites on Apache.org; for example, Hadoop and Spark.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight service provides several ways to use custom components.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight service provides several ways to use custom components.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of how a component is used or installed on the cluster, the same level of support applies.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of how a component is used or installed on the cluster, the same level of support applies.

trans-unit.source: Below is a list of the most common ways that custom components can be used on HDInsight clusters:
trans-unit.target: Below is a list of the most common ways that custom components can be used on HDInsight clusters:

trans-unit.source: Job submission - Hadoop or other types of jobs that execute or use custom components can be submitted to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Job submission - Hadoop or other types of jobs that execute or use custom components can be submitted to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Cluster customization - During cluster creation, you can specify additional settings and custom components that will be installed on the cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: Cluster customization - During cluster creation, you can specify additional settings and custom components that will be installed on the cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: Samples - For popular custom components, Microsoft and others may provide samples of how these components can be used on the HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Samples - For popular custom components, Microsoft and others may provide samples of how these components can be used on the HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: These samples are provided without support.
trans-unit.target: These samples are provided without support.
